Until -- A TORTOISE trudges into frame, an imposing prehistoric be from this angle. Three healed SCARS mar its shell -- remn of a lifelong shitstorm. And it’s about to get worse. A MASSIVE EARTHQUAKE HITS, the tortoise halts. A CRACK splinters in the earth’s crust -- ORANGE LIGHT bursts up Mother Nature takes the tortoise, burying it alive. Or de Who knows? Who cares?

He gazes ou with a look of recognition -- and resignation: A LARGE ESTATE at the end of the road, 100 yards down, in this otherwise pitch black desert valley. The MAIN HOUSE the center, with two large GUEST HOUSES, all connected through strands of twinkling lights extending down a long dirt driveway, packed full of hybrid cars. But these two. Tala Anne Harris and Abraham Eugene Trent Schlieffen, you proudly wave the middle finger in the face of all that negativity. Then you give it a thumbs up. Some smiles begin to trickle through the crowd.

Your optimism, your selflessness, it’s in your blood. Just look at Nana and Papa Schlieffen. They found hope, purpose, and empowerment through love. And I see that same fire burning in you two. You’1ll use your love for good. To inspire. To change. Tala leans into Abe --
How does he know all that? Abe shakes his head -- he has no clue.

Tala. Lovely, stunning Tala. Tonight’s true beacon of altruism. There’s something most people here probably don’t know about you, but they should, so they can all appreciate the wealth of humanity on display. I hope it’s okay? Tala has no idea what he’s about to say.
It’s not just time and money that Tala gives to so many charitable causes. She donated her physical self: bone marrow. (MORE )

While we all gorge that shit, she gave hers up to Baby Brother Nico, saving his life. Everyone is stunned by this revelation. Tala smiles at he hipster brother, NICO (23), through scattered applause --
You should clap, it’s scary! She gave so much. But now it’s time we give to you. Nyles locks eyes with Sarah, like he’s addressing her now

Here you are. On the precipice of something much larger than any of us, facing that wide open road. It may seem frightening, filled with uncertainty. But remember: you are not alone. Tala and Abe look at their guests, hanging on every word.

Everyone here is your family. We are your world. We will bolster you up when you’re low, and we will cheer you on with delight in our eyes as you fulfill your every dream. So, raise a glass. Nyles takes a Tecate from the pocket of his swim trunks a holds it up, again looking at Sarah:

A BACCHANALIAN DANCE PARTY. Guests bounce, groove, grind energized by the LOVE in the air. Tala Bhangras with her Howard. Nana Schlieffen shimmies with Jerry from Sudan. But she still declines. Nyles shrugs, then performs a flawless cartwheel back to center of the floor, narrowly kicking multiple guests yet somehow, missing each one by inches. He continues letting loose with Sarah’s family -- high-fives to Howard and Abe twirl for Pia, an undeniable master of this universe. Off Sarah, increasingly curious about this odd stranger.

As Nyles waits patiently at THE BAR, something hits his senses. He looks around, suddenly alert... He squints -- OFF IN THE DISTANCE: behind some shrubs, shrouded in dark a silhouette, swaying side to side... Is that a person?  Nyles SNIFFS the air...

Head in her hands, Sarah stares down at a double whiskey shot, still in a serious existential funk. Nyles leans against the bar, at home in this desert dive.
As I was saying, you have to find peace. One thing that’s nice is no one knows me at the wedding. Besides Misty, of course. You might have trouble with that.
They don’t want me there, I don’t want to be there, so it’s a win-win for all. Sarah shoots back her whiskey and slams it down for a ref Sore subject. Nyles notices. Sarah shifts course --  35.

At the DARTS BOARD behind them: Darla hits a bullseye. A disgruntled BIKER hands her cash.

Who the fuck are you?

To the struggle. Nyles and Roy take their shots -- just as the guests APPL around the dance floor. The WEDDING PARTY makes their gra entrance. There’s Misty and Trevor, Erin and Nico, Sarah Randy... And the guests go nuts as Tala and Abe stroll ou

Alright. I’m in. Nyles wobbles, dizzy, while watching Roy walk in through blurred vision. Nyles’ legs give out and he collapses ont his back, the toll of their binge catching up with him.

What the fuck’s that smell1?? (looking around) Jerry? But he’s not there. Nyles SNIFFS again, then --

So I vowed to never bring anyone else into this life again. Not everyone is cut out for it.

He stuck his penis in my butthole--

Sarah processes, confused. Nyles stares back. For a long
Okay, fine, that one didn’t happen. (continuing casually) What about you? Solid sex life?
I’m not going to fuck you, so don’t even try. Maybe would have the other night. Not now, though.
Girl, I was thinking the same thing. Sarah squints, studying him...
You promise we’ve never hooked up?
Again, my memory is shot, but I don’t think so. (looking up at the sun) Party’s about to start. Head back?
Uh. No. Why would I do that?
Eat, drink, dance. Bask in looove.
That’s not love.
Sure it is! Tala’s in love.
HA! For someone who knows everything, you really have no idea what you're talking about. Nyles sees he struck a bad chord there.
Tala and Abe are like 95% of all couples. (MORE )

They hit the point in their relationship where they got bored, but are so emotionally stunted they can’t be alone. So, they fall victim to the most archaic patriarchal scam of all time: marriage. Weddings: An industry designed to turn you against the one you ‘love.’ Nyles tries to chime in, but Sarah gets passionate --

How any woman with an ounce of self respect is okay spending tens of thousands of dollars so their father can ‘give them away,’ AND calls it the fucking high point of their life... it’s one of society's greatest tragedies. Nyles opens his mouth again, but --

Why, when anyone tries to simply start a dialogue is it always suppressed? Because we, you and me and everyone, are weak. We can’t stand the idea of being alone, so we buy into the pageantry and celebrate its bullshit. A long beat.
And the other 5% of couples?

They have a relaxed no-frills celebration without any friends or family, just free booze and their own mutual respect. They party like it’s their last night on earth, have incredible sex, and then -- they get divorced. We aren’t built to spend our entire lives with another person. Nyles sips his beer.
Okay. So, no wedding I guess. What do you want to do?  51. Sarah sits back, moving on.
Maybe it’s a karma thing?
What is?
Maybe that’s how I get out of this. Be selfless and you’re free.
I just bought you a hundred dollar Twix, and I’m still here.
No, real acts of selflessness. The bone marrow shit Tala does. She looks around at the various people at the taco stand.
Maybe life goes on for everyone else here, just not us, until we've earned our way out. So, tomorrow, that kid will still have a hundred bucks to spend.
And there’s a world where Tala is missing her teeth.
But there are millions of worlds where she isn’t. Have you really never thought of this before? Of course he has. Still, he humors her --
Okay. Maybe you’re right. Then what is the most selfless act you could do? Something that would absolutely guarantee an end to this day. Sarah thinks for a brief second. She knows what to do.

TRIBAL MUSIC begins and the guests quiet down for the ceremony. Two DANCERS in green leotards dance down the ai weaving between hay bales, tossing glitter on guests. From here we catch brief snapshots of the wedding: - Abe and his MOM stroll down the aisle to CHEERS. - The WEDDING PARTY walks down... Misty and Trevor, Erin Nico, Sarah and Randy. Nyles gives her two thumbs up. EVERYONE STANDS to watch Tala walk with Howard. As Tala a Abe meet at the altar, their faces stretch into the great smile of their lives. Abe’s eyes well up, Tala starts cry The Officiant wipes a tear. Howard sobs, Pia comforts him pan the audience: EVERYONE feels the love. And then there’s Sarah. She steps forward --
Hold up! Puzzled looks fill the crowd. Nyles, too. At this point h has no idea what her “selfless act” actually is.

What are you doing? Sarah ignores him and takes the mic from The Officiant. She holds it up to her mouth, words on the tip of her tongue... but looking out at audience, and then to Tala.. she reconsiders, and lowers the mic. She walks up to Tala, pulls her into a tight hug and says something inaudible into her ear. The onlooking crowd wai

(quietly to Nyles) What is she doing? Nyles shrugs. No clue. Sarah releases the hug, tears fill her eyes. She hands th mic to The Officiant, the flowers to Pia, and walks away. Everyone turns to Tala for an explanation. She’s in shock Speechless. She looks at her parents, a silent cry for he At Abe. At everyone. Heavy breathing, the world is ending
EVERYBODY PANICS. Pia holds Tala. Howard holds the altar steady. One guest sprints away. A baby cries. Nyles remains calm, but confused -- THE EARTHQUAKE STOPS. The guests glance around with relie
Look at that. The gods have spoken and they approve this marriage! But Tala is now SOBBING into Pia’s shoulder.
Sarah’s far more relaxed, with an almost celebratory vibe she takes shots and plays pool with a couple barflies. The front door swings open, Nyles steps in --
What the hell did you say to her?
Doesn't matter, sister stuff. But I think I’m good. Karma’s fucking great. Selflessness is fantastic. Sarah hits two balls in at once.
Pay up boys. The barflies she was playing each hand her $20.
(to the Ted the Bartender) Two shots of your finest whiskey. Ted pours the shots. Sarah holds one out for Nyles --

Well, Nyles, it’s been great. Or, interesting, at least. If this ever happens again, please keep me out of the cave. Good luck with the psychopath. Deal with him. Maybe that’s your way out. They clink their glasses and take the shot.
INT. NYLES’ AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles sleeps in bed. Just another day. Someone POUNDING o the door. Misty wraps a towel around her body --
Hold on, I’m coming! She unlocks it and Sarah barges in, straight to Nyles --
What the hell, Sarah? Nyles jolts up.
Didn't work. Life is meaningless. Let’s get the fuck out of here. She heads out. Misty looks at Nyles as he rolls out of be
Are you -- Nyles jumps in --
-- fucking cheating on me? -- fucking cheating on me? Nyles pulls on his swim trunks --
(in unison) What? ... This isn’t funny. Nyles puts on his Hawaiian shirt, Misty is freaking out -
Okay, stop... I’m serious... Don’t copy me... Stop pretending like you know everything... I hate, agh -- And this back and forth takes us into --
